::Savanna::

She looked at Phobia. "I don't trust you. I'll make no secret of 
that. I see that the others are Maximals.  But because we share the 
same symbol doesn't mean automatic trust.  Even in the pride lands, 
trust and loyalty is earned and proven. I do not trust others 
easily."  She emmitted a low growl.  She kept her eyes on the 
others.  She would have to have them prove themselves to her as much 
as she would have to prove herself to them. Her code of honor 
demanded it.  But she thought she could loosen up a bit and give the 
appearence of being more comfortable.  Even when she wasn't, she 
could show it to the others and put them on a less a defencive 
stand.  She smiled and nodded. "OK, I see that we are on the same 
side for the moment. I'll relax as you put it Kluster."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Phobia glanced back toward Savanna, he could see the distrust in 
her 
> eyes, she didn't seem to be able to look anywhere for more than a 
> second without looking back toward him.
> 
> "Savanna my dear, you can come closer, I don't bite." A spider that 
> didn't bite, unbelievable he thought , he understood her fealings, 
he 
> would be wary of her if thier posisitions were reversed, but then 
> again she'd be dead, or in chains if the situations were reversed.
> 
> he was almost glad that the Maximals were more on courtesy and 
> information, or he'd be deleated by now.
>
